org.apache.juneau.server

Class RestServletContext

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.juneau.Context
      • org.apache.juneau.server.RestServletContext

  • public final class RestServletContext
extends Context
    Configurable properties on the RestServlet class.

    Properties can be set on the RestServlet class using the RestResource.properties() or RestMethod.properties() annotations.

    These properties can also be passed in as servlet init parameters or system properties.

    Some of these properties are only applicable on the servlet class, and others can be specified on the servlet class or method.
    These distinctions are noted below.

    See ContextFactory for more information about context properties.

    Author:
    James Bognar (james.bognar@salesforce.com)

    • Field Detail

      • REST_allowHeaderParams

        public static final String REST_allowHeaderParams
        Allow header URL parameters (Boolean, default=true).

        When enabled, headers such as "Accept" and "Content-Type" to be passed in as URL query parameters. For example: "?Accept=text/json&Content-Type=text/json"

        Parameter names are case-insensitive.

        Useful for debugging REST interface using only a browser.

        Applicable to servlet class only.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • REST_allowMethodParam

        public static final String REST_allowMethodParam
        Allow "method" URL parameter for specific HTTP methods (String, default="", example="HEAD,OPTIONS").

        When specified, the HTTP method can be overridden by passing in a "method" URL parameter on a regular GET request. For example: "?method=OPTIONS"

        Parameter name is case-insensitive. Use "*" to represent all methods. For backwards compatibility, "true" also means "*".

        Note that per the HTTP specification, special care should be taken when allowing non-safe (POST, PUT, DELETE) methods to be invoked through GET requests.

        Applicable to servlet class only.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • REST_allowContentParam

        public static final String REST_allowContentParam
        Allow "content" URL parameter (Boolean, default=true).

        When enabled, the HTTP body content on PUT and POST requests can be passed in as text using the "content" URL parameter. For example: "?content={name:'John%20Smith',age:45}"

        Parameter name is case-insensitive.

        Useful for debugging PUT and POST methods using only a browser.

        Applicable to servlet class only.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • REST_renderResponseStackTraces

        public static final String REST_renderResponseStackTraces
        Render stack traces in HTTP response bodies when errors occur (Boolean, default=false).

        When enabled, Java stack traces will be rendered in the output response. Useful for debugging, although allowing stack traces to be rendered may cause security concerns.

        Applicable to servlet class only.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • REST_useStackTraceHashes

        public static final String REST_useStackTraceHashes
        Use stack trace hashes (Boolean, default=true).

        When enabled, the number of times an exception has occurred will be determined based on stack trace hashsums, made available through the RestException.getOccurrence() method.

        Applicable to servlet class only.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • REST_defaultCharset

        public static final String REST_defaultCharset
        The default character encoding for the request and response if not specified on the request (String>, default="utf-8").

        Applicable to servlet class and methods.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • REST_paramFormat

        public static final String REST_paramFormat
        The expected format of request parameters (String, default="UON").

        Possible values:

        • "UON" - URL-Encoded Object Notation.
          This notation allows for request parameters to contain arbitrarily complex POJOs.
        • "PLAIN" - Plain text.
          This treats request parameters as plain text.
          Only POJOs directly convertable from Strings can be represented in parameters when using this mode.

        Note that the parameter value "(foo)" is interpreted as "(foo)" when using plain mode, but "foo" when using UON mode.

        The format can also be specified per-parameter using the @Param.format() and @QParam.format() annotations.

        Applicable to servlet class and methods.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • REST_servletPath

        public static final String REST_servletPath
        The request servlet path.

        Automatically added to properties return by RestServlet.createRequestProperties(org.apache.juneau.ObjectMap, RestRequest) and are therefore available through SerializerSession.getProperties() and ParserSession.getProperties().

        Equivalent to the value returned by HttpServletRequestWrapper.getServletPath()

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • REST_servletURI

        public static final String REST_servletURI
        The request servlet URI.

        Equivalent to the value returned by RestRequest.getServletURI()

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • REST_relativeServletURI

        public static final String REST_relativeServletURI
        The request servlet URI.

        Equivalent to the value returned by RestRequest.getRelativeServletURI()

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • REST_pathInfo

        public static final String REST_pathInfo
        The request URI path info.

        Automatically added to properties return by RestServlet.createRequestProperties(org.apache.juneau.ObjectMap, RestRequest) and are therefore available through SerializerSession.getProperties() and ParserSession.getProperties().

        Equivalent to the value returned by HttpServletRequestWrapper.getPathInfo()

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

        public static final String REST_requestURI

        Automatically added to properties return by RestServlet.createRequestProperties(org.apache.juneau.ObjectMap, RestRequest) and are therefore available through SerializerSession.getProperties() and ParserSession.getProperties().

        Equivalent to the value returned by HttpServletRequestWrapper.getRequestURI()

        Equivalent to the value returned by RestRequest.getMethod()
